On september 1, 2016
Dream
Inspiration for the people

Live2gether, Die Alone Event

welcome to Die2nite´s next Event in Season 13 which will start on

  • Sunday September 11th directly after the attack at 23.20 server time here is an exact Count Down
  • Here is the Sign Up Form with detailed infos
    you will need to give your exact nickname in die2nite and give needed infos about how you will jump on september 11th. and if you cant be online at that time we will form coalitions which can drag you with them. so you must respond to any twinoid PMs the organizers will send you to send or accept coalition invites.
  • Here is the List of all Sign Ups visible for all to see
  • Here is the IRC Chat Channel we will be using for chat for general discussion and anything related to this event.
  • Here is the Coalitions Spread Sheet which must be created and invite sent to members who signed up and need a coalition to join the event
    _______________________________________________________

we will be having 5 contest categories during this event with prizes for:

1- The Winning town:with highest score will get 3 randomly chosen citizens who managed to survive passed day 5 in that town to win each 15 hero days.
2- Last Resident Alive: the last resident who will die last during the entire event (regardless where you die, in- or outside): 15 Hero days.
3- 1 x Randomly chosen player of all participants who managed to survive passed day 10: will win 15 Hero days
4- 1 x Randomly chosen player of all participants who managed to survive passed day 15: will win 15 Hero days
5- 1 x Wild Card for a Legendary Town in Season 14:
Each town must nominate 2 of the most active citizen they have who are interested in being part of a legendary town in season 14 before day 10. after day 10 its too late for your town. (each town will have to make their own election in their forum to pick those 2 persons in any way they want or vote for) and all nominees from each town will be part of a raffle randomly run in this thread by end of the event and the winner of that raffle will win a guaranteed spot in the "season 14 #1 leaderboard Attempt town to win a legendary town distinction along with Alarm Clock item which gives you 1 bonus AP daily in season 15

there is a small chance for special distinction for all participants of the winning town if the Devs will agree to do it. we will know when they have time to decide and reply.
______________________________________________________

The winner town will be decided as the town with the highest score of points collected following those 20 possibilities:

1 - for your town reaching specific day you will gain:
13 Points for reaching day 10
6 additional Points for reaching day 15
2 additional Points for reaching day 20
1 additional Points for reaching day 25+

2 - 3 Points for coming up with a Team Name and Poster which must be reported in this thread by end of day 7.

3- 3 Points for having at least 28 themed matching/similar Avatars. Avatars will be checked on day 10 via Map Viewer, and they must be kept til end of your town. after day 10 its too late for getting the points though so don´t be late and miss it.

4- 5 Point for building at least 5 extreme projects (any project listed under the category "Foundations" except Bonfire because Bonfire is temporary. only permanent projects count), you wont get additional points if you build more than 5 extreme projects! its only for first 5 projects.

5 - 3 Points for building at least one child project of Guardtower. so one of the following 4 projects: (Shooting Gallery , Miniature Armory, Swedish Workshop or Small Trebuchet) only one of those 4 is needed to get the 3 points!

6 - 1 Point for building Grapeboom.

7 - 1 x Point for each Järpen Table in bank or used in Construction Site (for Factory, Searchtower, Registry) the extra JTs must be kept in bank at all times to be visible via Map Viewer.

8 - 5 Points for having at least 12 Guitars in bank before day 20 (will be verified with mapviewer)

9 - 2 points for a "Party in the Desert" screen shot of the town´s shaman and additional 2 people in the same zone at exactly 9 km range (NOT 9 AP, it must be 9 KM) reported here before day 15 with:
(Twinoid, Bag of Damp Grass, Vodka, charged Vibrator, Guitar, Mystic potion). ALL 6 items must be on the ground and one must type a short joke in the zone´s chat including the word "[habitant]" in the end of the joke which must be visible before you take the screen shot ([habitant] types a random name of the players in your town). (the funniest 2 jokes of all reported screenshots will gain an additional 1 point. there will be 3 judges to decide that...)

10 - 2 Points for bringing at least one Sealed Architect Chest to the bank ,it must be visible in Map Viewer in your bank on the day you bring it home and must stay in bank til after the attack. on the next day you can open it or move it from bank as you wish.

11 - 2 Points for building at least ONE wonder. you wont get additional points if you build more than 1.

12 - 3 points for building Reactor (if you reach day 20 then the reactor explodes its same gain of 3 points as if your town lives 30+ days , this is set like this to make sure that no one is forced to build useless projects like reactor to win if they prefer maximum survival)

13 - 2 points for having at least 8 Exploding water bombs in bank at some point during your town visible in mapviewer (they DO NOT need to be filled with water. its 100% ok if they are empty)

14 - 1 Point for each Devastator or Mk2 you build Before the town gets devastated. (your bank will be verified with mapviewer one day before your town devastates so make sure to keep all your guns in bank one day before your devastation day. and any new builds after devastation will NOT give any more points).

15 - 2 points for building a Half zombie zoo which is killing all zeds in one half of the map and maintaining it zed-free til day 15 which could be entire section of one of those 4 directions : (North, West, South or East) (here is an Example)
(if you manage to build a full zoo you gain same points as half zoo , but the advantages for your end score are of course bigger if you manage to build a full zoo with 3 corners zed free instead of just 2 corners.)

16 - 3 Points for building AND upgrading Architect Study to level 3 (will be verified via Mapviewer).

17 - 4 Points for collecting at least 60 Defensive Objects in bank before the town dies (it doesnt matter if they get dumped using Defence Dump. (it will be verified by Organizers with mapviewer)

18 - 1 Point for building a complete Cafeteria (the one which requires cyanide to get built to allow you to make coffee)

19 - 1 point if the town manages to get at least 2 persons at least 1 "zen camper" distinction (Zen camper is a distinction you get when someoene successfully survives camping one night after the town has been devastated after day 10, this will be verified in mapviewer)

20 - to be Added before the event starts.
_____________________________________________________

that´s a bit against the spirit of a community Event which is to NOT KNOW who you will end up with except only the 4 in your coalition. i would even prefer to do more splitting actually by preventing to have more than 3 of the same meta members in each coalition to split the entire community in all towns so all can learn new things, BUT splitting full coas is realistically NOT possible, because first not all will agree to split their full coalitions and second its a nightmare to manage over 300 people in coalitions relying on all jumpers and members to send invites and accept them on time. so i wont go near splitting full coalitions surely.

also metas sticking together is unfair and gives huge advantage to few teams to win the first 2 prizes of the contest and make the whole thing boring, because there are few metas who could possibly win this hing with only 25 people even if the other 15 do nothing except stay alive doe a short while inside. and all that in spite me reducing the points for top results towns so that their score can still be close to a town which finds more JTs or Devastators and other lucky stuff. we want to create exact same conditions for all towns and see all competing hard to win or make it damn hard for others to win. The main goal is to have at least 5 from the total 8 towns we may get all having very close scores, so that the winner wont be decided til the very end and with a lot of hard work. and also we want all players to try new strategies and new ideas to boost their results to win which will be Gold for teaching new players or even meta members who usually stick to their own strategies and rarely new strategies. that is why there is a contest running to control the direction of the event to be exciting and more fun.

if i remember correctly the Wonder Games MMJ back in season 11 was a lot of fun , but the problem there was that the top 2 towns got the majority of experience and heroes and the rest got low numbers of those. this time i wish we can avoid that if possible.

  • then we will include all players who managed to survive 15 days during the entire whole event from all towns except the 3 winners from first town and randomly select one to win the 4th prize. this winner will be excluded from the next raffle.

A lot of people in town were like what is EE ?
Why does it matter?

So here's what our EE map currently
looks like as of Day 10 mid-day:

http://s12.postimg.org/slcm269gt/day1...

EE means Expert Expedition with an area over 18km +

which means that it cannot be reached without camping
or lots of coffee or being hooked.

We have 3 corners where this is an issue.
NE corner, if scouted early can be controlled easily.

NW and SW corner needs camping day 3
and lots of motivated people on chat
to do resupply missions with HR.

As only scout / surv would camp in the EE area normally
and have to quickly kill everything down to 0 for each square,
because after that it becomes unmanageable,
if sufficiently populated with buildings / zombies.

On a side note, the scout who camped in EE area early in town,
died with 90% max-decent camping chances...
then nobody even approached the EE area since then.

to those who are reading this Thread: when you see some posts from fdamned26 , he is 88% of the time missing something written in the rules or ignoring something in the rules and other times talking about something completely irrelevant to the subject. its because he has a slight problem concentrating when reading a full text. he reads only what he likes and on 88% of the time he skips last 5 words in each paragraph of the text. sometimes he skips only last 4 words , it all depends on how much coffee he drank in the morning or on his mood. history proves he always talks about something you either dont need to know about at all or he assumes something wrong or misunderstands the rules. but to be fair on 12% of the time he is right and just ACE.

if there was any other way to describe it or sugar code it i would have , but sadly there isnt.

now about the Half Zoo:
15 - 2 points for building a Half zombie zoo which is killing all zeds in one half of the map and maintaining it zed-free til day 15 which could be entire section of one of those 4 directions : (North, West, South or East) (here is an Example)
(if you manage to build a full zoo you gain same points as half zoo , but the advantages for your end score are of course bigger if you manage to build a full zoo with 3 corners zed free instead of just 2 corners.)


the center of each map when its about zombie zoos is not the middle of the 25x 25 or 26x26 or 27x27 Square. the Center is always where the town is and according to where the town is located, that divides the map is 4 Quarters which are almost NEVER equal in size, BUT Each of them is nothing but 1/4 of the map regardless how many zones are in it.

and the definition of the zombie zoo from any perspective is to have 3 of those quarters zombie free and lock the zombies in the 4th and last quarter between the 2 walls of the map and 2 zoo borders facing the town´s location.

now since a half zoo is needed in this event for bonus points, all that changes for the definition for the zoo rule is that you only need 2 quarters of the map zombie free and the other 2 quarters are full of zeds ALL in relation to the location of the town which is NOT the center of the map.

A half zoo has nothing to do with the number of zones in it. its just a simple one direction left , right , up or down from the town´s Row or Column which has the number 0.

i am almost sure that the majority in Morbid hideout of monkeys know that a half zoo in their map is only the section above the town from row 0 til row 8. and that is the only section they need to keep green to have a valid half zoo and with it gain points.

killing zeds from row -1 til row -4 is not needed at all and i am almost sure you guys are doing it when possible to gain more green scavenging ground and open paths to buildings for camping later. there is no harm in that at all, BUT dont pay attention to whatever fdamned26 said about what you need to do!. you guys know a lot more than what he is talking about.

Great event.

It was a lot of fun and judging by many of the comments, I think a lot of people got to see a new side to of the game when playing in an organised town.

Being part of the Monkey crew, I am of course thrilled that we ended up winning the event. But as everyone can see from the score, it was very even among the top 3. We just had a bit more luck.
Well played everyone.

Personally, I'm surprised we could keep up whit the others towns, considering it took us more than 2 weeks to find the hacksaw, that's a lot of Ap wasted. We did get a good start on other things, like jarpen tables though, so perhaps that made up for it.


Overall I think this makes a good template for future events of the same type. The different collecting missions was difficult and whit a good tactical twist, at least in our town there was some debate on using the EWB's or not.

Thanks for the event Dream

    Morbid Monkeys ( Morbid hideout of monkeys)
    mapviewr link: http://die2nite.gamerz.org.uk/town/38...
    which managed to survive longer than the other town which tied with them with same score of 70 points. and since Morbid Monkeys reported finding sealed architect chests in spite failing to save it in mapviewer technically that puts them 2 points ahead with 72 points total and will be declared the clear winner of the First Live2gether, DieAlone Event without any Question.
    The 3 Winners from The Winning town randomly chosen who managed to survive passed day 5 to win each 15 hero days are:
    DeathStalker (Morbid hideout of monkeys)
    Shirowolf (Morbid hideout of monkeys)
    CatNoir (Morbid hideout of monkeys)
  • 2- Last Resident Alive:
    the Winner Residents who managed to be the last Residents to die during the entire Event on day 27 is:
    si-fon (Tundra of reptiles)
  • 3- 1 x Randomly chosen Winner of all participants who managed to survive passed day 10 winning 15 Hero days is:
    KOFKOREA (Clouded corridor of madness)
  • 4- 1 x Randomly chosen Winner of all participants who managed to survive passed day 15 winning 15 Hero days is:
    Kawaiii (Wet districts of madness)
  • 5- 1 x Wild Card for a Legendary Town in Season 14 Winner is:
    Jerms (Wet districts of madness)

Conrgatz to all winners and i hope all have enjoyed the Event. if MT will ever support Events again in the future i will try to run this event next season 14.

i have seen 6 towns all work hard to play organized with all the known successful strategies to live long and keep everyone alive , and 4 of them successfully build a half zoo and 3 of those 4 even built a complete zoo and lasted over 20+ days without having a full meta team on board and instead a mix of new players and random players and BIG respect and Cheers to Ingsoc and friends who managed to be just 1 point short of winning in spite playing in a HC maps when all other towns were disant. so i consider the goal of this event has been reached and i hope the majority will carry on with team work and what they have learned during this event in all your future towns even if they will be small or random towns.

the prizes will be sent in next 48 hours via private twinoid messages
